intro: Pentacalia cazaletii, commonly known as the Cazalet's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers during the summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticultural enthusiasts.
